intro: Microthlaspi mediterraneo-orientale, commonly known as the Mediterranean rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Microthlaspi mediterraneo-orientale is often found in alpine and subalpine areas, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
